isis.stitle: TSI 08-12-02 - Release New Wear Sleeve Removal Tool

subjectgroup.subject: Release New Wear Sleeve Removal Tool

geninfo.para: A new Wear Sleeve / Removal Tool (ZTSE4889) has been released. This tool is used to remove the old wear sleeve from the crankshaft flange.

note.para: Be sure to use the removal and installation procedures provided in this TSI when using the new Wear Sleeve / Removal Tool. The new tool is easier to use than the Wear Sleeve / Removal tool specified in the EGES 345 Engine Service Manual.

svcproc.title: Removal of Crankshaft Rear Oil Seal

step1.para: See Engine Service Manual to remove flywheel or flexplate.

note.para: Production engines did not include a wear sleeve with the crankshaft rear oil seal. A wear sleeve is part of the crankshaft rear oil seal used for service.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields when doing the following procedure.

figure.caption: Figure 1. Removal of crankshaft rear oil seal

step1.para: Use an awl or 1/8 inch drill bit to make two small starter holes in crankshaft rear oil seal 180° apart.
Thread slide hammer screw into one of the starter holes.

note.para: To remove seal evenly, use slide hammer on one side, then the other side.

step1.para: Remove crankshaft rear oil seal from crankshaft rear oil seal carrier and discard.

figure.caption: Figure 2. Wear Sleeve Removal Tool kit ZTSE4889

note.para: Production engines did not include a wear sleeve with the crankshaft rear oil seal. A wear sleeve is part of the crankshaft rear oil seal used for service.

step1.para: Install Distorter Ring ZTSE4889-2 of Rear Wear Sleeve Removal Tool.

note.para: A socket wrench with an extension should be used with the Distorter Shaft ZTSE4889-1.

step1.para: Position Distorter Shaft (pointed edge facing wear sleeve) and insert between wear sleeve and Distorter Ring until it bottoms out against gear.
Slowly turn Distorter Shaft clockwise to apply force against the wear sleeve.

note.para: The Distorter Shaft will dent and expand the wear sleeve at the contact point, without cutting through the wear sleeve.

step1.para: Repeat steps 6 and 7 three times 90° apart.

svcproc.title: Installation of Crankshaft Rear Oil Seal and Wear Sleeve Assembly

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields. Limit compressed air pressure to 207 kPa (30 psi).

step1.para: Clean crankshaft flange with a suitable solvent and dry flange with filtered compressed air.
Apply a 360° bead of Loctite® Hydraulic Sealant on rear edge of crankshaft flange.
Align base of Rear Oil Seal Installer ZTSE4515-B with alignment dowel on crankshaft flange and install base.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not separate wear sleeve from new crankshaft rear oil seal; this will damage seal.

figure.caption: Figure 6. Crankshaft rear oil seal and wear sleeve assembly

note.para: Before assembly, lubricate outer diameter of crankshaft rear oil seal with a solution of dish soap and water (approximately 50/50 mix). Do not use other lubricants.

figure.caption: Figure 7. Installation of Crankshaft rear oil seal and wear sleeve assembly

calloutgroup.callout1: Crankshaft rear oil seal and wear sleeve assembly

step1.para: Position a new crankshaft rear oil seal and wear sleeve assembly onto hub of Rear Oil Seal Installer (base).

figure.caption: Figure 8. Installation of Crankshaft rear oil seal and wear sleeve assembly

calloutgroup.callout1: Crankshaft rear oil seal and wear sleeve assembly

step1.para: Put forcing collar (ZTSE4515-2C), thrust bearing, and drive nut on threaded shaft.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not use an air impact wrench to tighten drive nut.

step1.para: Tighten drive nut until the forcing collar bottoms out on Rear Oil Seal Installer (base).
See Engine Service Manual to install flywheel or flexplate.
